entry.title: BW Note Validation in SAC: Instantly see whether your BW backend is up to date
entry.content:
Keeping your BW system up to date ensures that you get the most out of your SAC stories designed with BW Live connections. To make full use of the latest SAC innovations, enhancements, and fixes, it is recommended to update your BW support package at least once a year as outlined in SAP Note 2541557. Applying the relevant note collections through the SAP BW Note Analyzer also helps maintain smooth compatibility and performance.

For those wondering whether their BW system is aligned with SAC, there is now an easy way to check. SAC displays a clear status message in the story edit mode and within the support agent. This helps to quickly see if your connected BW system is in sync with the current SAC recommendations or if it needs attention.

What is BW Note Validation

BW Note Validation checks the BW system information returned by your live connection and compares it with SAP‚Äôs guidance to determine if the BW system needs to be upgraded. It summarizes the result in two ratings:

  • QRC version rating: how your BW backend aligns with the current SAC quarterly release cycle guidance.
  • Support Package (SP) rating: whether your BW system‚Äôs support package level meets minimum recommended levels.

The ratings are shown as status icon and text details so you can immediately see if everything is fine, if an update is recommended, or if the system is out of date.

Where you can see it

  • Support Agent:
    • After recording: When you complete a Support Agent recording, the result view includes BW Note Validation with QRC and SP ratings for the BW systems involved in the session.
      BW Note Validation in Support Tool (recording)
    • When loading an SST file: If you load an SST file into the Support Agent, the validation runs on the captured environment and displays the ratings.
      BW Note Validation in Support Tool (playback)
  • Story Info panel (edit mode): In a story that uses live BW connections, open the Info panel while in edit mode to see the BW Note Validation ratings. This helps story designers quickly confirm their bw backend is up to date or needs attention.
    BW Note Validation in Info Panel

What the ratings mean

  • Up to date: Your BW system meets or exceeds the current guidance for the active SAC installation.
  • Good: Your BW system is in a good condition, but new releases are available.
  • Acceptable: Your BW system is functional, but lags recommended levels; consider scheduling an update.
  • Critical: Your BW system is below supported guidance; an update is strongly advised to avoid issues.

Typical workflows

  • In Support Agent recording mode:
    • Start a recording and reproduce the scenario.
    • After stopping the recording, you will have a link with ‚ÄúMore information‚Äù.
    • This will open a popup showing the ratings for systems found in your workflow.
  • In Support Agent playback mode
    • In the playback tab, load an existing SST.
    • If this file includes information about the BW ratings, you will see a link saying, ‚ÄúNote status‚Äù.
    • Clicking this will open a popup showing the ratings for systems found in your recording.
  • In a Story (edit mode):
    • Open your story that uses a live BW model.
    • Open the Info panel.
    • In the ‚ÄúIssues‚Äù tab you can find the information about the BW system ratings in the ‚ÄúStory‚Äù section.

Scope and prerequisites

  • BW Note Validation applies to BW live connections used by SAC stories.
  • The feature relies on BW system metadata available to SAC via the live connection.
  • If a story uses multiple BW connections, you will see a rating per connection.
  • Non-BW sources are not included in this validation.
  • Ratings are informative; they do not block usage. Stories remain usable even when the backend is rated Critical.

Release timeline

  • Support Agent display: SAC QRC1.2026.
  • Story Info panel display: SAC QRC1.2026.
  • SAP Note 3554618, "BW InA: SAC BW InA Support Tool"

Why it matters

BW Note Validation gives authors and support teams instant visibility into backend status, reducing the time spent on manual checks and helping you proactively plan updates. It also adds valuable context when investigating issues via the Support Agent, so you can quickly rule in‚Äîor out‚Äîbackend version alignment as a contributing factor.

We‚Äôd love your feedback

Try BW Note Validation when it becomes available in your tenant and let us know what you think. Also please share questions and suggestions here, we are happy to help.

entry.title: The Future of Amusement Parks: How SAP Powers the Next Wave of Thrill & Technology
entry.content:
The Future of Amusement Parks: How SAP Powers the Next Wave of Thrill & Technology

When I attended the SAP Top Architect Bootcamp, I expected to deepen my understanding of SAP solutions‚Äîand I certainly did. But what surprised me was how often my thoughts drifted back to the world I live in every day: the amusement-park industry, where I‚Äôve spent the past two years shaping experiences, studying operations, and watching how technology transforms guest expectations.

As a mother, my visits to theme parks with my son have also given me a unique, personal perspective. Watching his excitement, his curiosity, and how he interacts with attractions helped me see first-hand how the future of theme parks must evolve.

So, with every SAP capability I explored‚Äîacross CX, analytics, BTP, AI, and sustainability‚ÄîI couldn‚Äôt help but imagine: What would the theme park of the future look like for me and my son?

  1. Personalised Guest Experiences ‚Äî The Magic of SAP CX

The Story Begins:

The moment my son and I scan our tickets, our park experience transforms.

My phone buzzes with a personalised route suggestion‚Äîhighlighting shorter queues, shaded rest spots, and our favourite attractions. Meanwhile, my son receives a notification from his wearable wristband inviting him to meet his favourite character nearby. This hyper-personalised experience is powered by SAP CX.

  • Builds rich guest profiles for both adults and children, tailoring our journey. We can enhance the same using SAP Customer Data Platform - https://www.sap.com/products/data-cloud/customer-data-platform.html which seamlessly integrates into a 360¬∞ customer profile.
  • Sends AI-driven recommendations‚Äîlike a quiet snack zone when kids need a break. This can be leverage with SAP Emarsys - https://www.sap.com/products/crm/emarsys.html  as  it offers personalised suggestions
  • Personalised bundles for families, child-specific deals, and dynamic pricing. This can be achieved  SAP Commerce Cloudhttps://www.sap.com/india/products/crm/commerce-cloud.html.
  • Smooth, intuitive interfaces across mobile and wearables. SAP Build Apps ( https://www.sap.com/india/products/technology-platform/low-code-app-builder.html) and Spartacus (https://community.sap.com/t5/crm-and-cx-blog-posts-by-members/introduction-to-spartacus/ba-p/13418581) can help us to build intuitive interfaces.

For families like ours, this means a day that feels designed just for us.

  1. Immersive AR/VR Worlds ‚Äî Powered by SAP BTP

The Adventure Expands:

As my son and I stroll through the enchanted forest zone, he suddenly gasps. A digital dragon appears‚Äîhovering above us, reacting to his movements and responding to his excitement. He chases it playfully, and the AR storyline adapts in real time to his reactions.

That magic is orchestrated by SAP BTP:

  • Ensuring AR storytelling adapts to our real-world location . SAP Event Mesh can be used to achieve the same(https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/integration-suite/capabilities/event-mesh.html)
  • Links my son‚Äôs wearable profile so the experience feels personal. SAP Integration Suite can be used for personalised and dynamic experience.(https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/integration-suite.html)
  • Behind the scenes, analytics help the park understand which experiences engage you most, enabling continuous optimization of these immersive zones and this can be achieved by SAP Analytics Cloud (https://www.sap.com/products/data-cloud/cloud-analytics.html).    

These immersive experiences create unforgettable moments‚Äîfor children and adults alike.

  1. Intelligent Park Operations ‚Äî AI, IoT & Automation at Work

As my son and I enjoy our day, SAP technology silently ensures everything runs flawlessly.

  • Monitoring of ride safety in real time, giving parents like me peace of mind .SAP IoT(https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_IoT/fffd6ca18e374c2e80688dab5c31527f/3c61bd1bedc4473fbd952e92b5e7cf8d.html) sensors monitor ride performance in real time, ensuring that everything operates at peak performance.
  • Technicians use AR-guided repairs to minimize downtime which can be managed by SAP Field Service Management (https://www.sap.com/india/products/scm/field-service-management/what-is-field-service-management.html).
  • AI ensures enough staff are available at family-heavy zones. SAP SuccessFactors  - https://www.sap.com/india/products/hcm.html.
  • Streamlines operations so staff can focus on guest care. SAP Build Process Automation can be used for automating the manual processes.https://www.sap.com/india/products/technology-platform/process-automation/features.html

This invisible intelligence creates a smoother, safer experience‚Äîespecially for families with young children.

  1. Sustainability at the Core ‚Äî Enabled by SAP‚Äôs Green Solutions.

As we walk, I feel proud showing my son how the park embraces sustainability. Showing him recycling stations that are intelligently placed based on crowd flow, solar panels integrated into ride structures, and sustainable materials used in the food packaging and merchandise, enhance my son‚Äôs understanding of sustainability.

SAP can helps us to enable this shift by using products like 

  • SAP Sustainability Control Tower (https://www.sap.com/india/products/scm/sustainability-control-tower.html) for environmental analytics
  • SAP Responsible Design & Production  (https://www.sap.com/india/products/scm/responsible-design-and-production.html) for greener materials
  • SAP Waste Management  (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ERP/8a399f5444164440ac4f426e847ec901/7567bd534f22b44ce10000000a174cb4.html) powered by IoT.
  • SAP Green Ledger (https://www.sap.com/india/products/financial-management/green-ledger.html) tying sustainability to financial accountability.

This creates a park not just fun‚Äîbut responsible.

  1. Data as the Heartbeat of the Connected Park

For families like mine, the magic is seamless‚Äîbut behind the scenes, data orchestrates is everything. Every twist, turn, and laugh in the park is driven by data. You might not see the data at work, but it‚Äôs there, ensuring the best possible experience for you, every step of the way.

From real-time ride performance to the preferences of every guest, SAP can be used to unify data, ensuring that everything works in harmony.

SAP‚Äôs data-driven approach can be helpful every part of the park:

  • All guest and operational data is integrated into one foundation, enabling real-time, personalised experiences. SAP Datasphere ( https://www.sap.com/products/data-cloud/datasphere.html ) can be leverage for the same 
  • Systems like ticketing, AR/VR, and mobile apps needs to work seamlessly together to create a unified digital experience and this can be managed  by SAP Integration Suite (https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/integration-suite.html)
  • Predictive analytics help the park optimize everything from crowd flow to ride performance, ensuring an efficient and exciting day for all visitors. Here we can use SAP Analytics Cloud (https://www.sap.com/products/data-cloud/cloud-analytics.html) to help to do Predictive analytics.
  • Advanced AI models forecast guest behaviour, allowing the park to continuously enhance experiences and predict future trends. SAP AI Core (https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/serviceCatalog/sap-ai-core) can be leveraged for the same.

üåü The Future of Fun, Built on SAP ‚Äî For Families, For Dreamers, For Everyone

As my son and I leave the park, tired but smiling, I realise this is what the next generation of amusement parks must deliver‚Äîa world where operational excellence, cutting-edge technology, and deeply personal experiences collide.

entry.title: Support of Working Day Calendar in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Background

A Working Day, also known as Business Day or Factory Day, is an official work day. And the working day calendar, if compared with standard calendar, it will exclude the weekends (Saturday and Sunday) together with national holidays.

In SAP Analytics Cloud, there will be some activities need to be scheduled in a recursive way, such as a daily work, a weekly or bi-weekly work. In the past, these activities can be planned using the standard calendar. But the standard calendar can not differentiate between a working day or a non-working day. As a consequence, some un-necessary tasks will be activated and lead to additional house-keeping effort.

Starting from QRC4 2025, working day calendar is now supported in SAP Analytics Cloud. User can now define recurrence settings using a working day calendar. Series based on working day calendars will have no occurrences on non-working days.

How to set up a working day calendar

Before use the working day calendar in the recurrence settings, a working day calendar needs to be defined in advance. Customers need to define their own working day calendars, since different regions may have their own working day calendars. This can be achieved by defining a Date dimension as User-Managed instead of System-Managed dimension. Because by defining a user-managed data dimension, user can add additional properties to that date dimension and use those properties to indicate whether it is a working day or non-working day.

User can create a new property like the below screenshot:

Please make sure the property ID is started with "CAL_WORKING_DAY_" so the system will recognize this property as working day calendar. And then maintain the property for each member. 1 for working days and 0 for non-working days.

 

Customers may ask, does that mean I should modify the Date dimension for all my existing models?

The answer is NO. The related recurrence setting will allow user to select a working day calendar from a different model. This means, user can create a model with working day calendar defined, and reuse that model in different scenarios and related models. Although custom can use an existing model and enhance the date dimension accordingly, but it could be more convenient to create a brand-new model, so the working calendar can be managed centrally without impact existing models. And there's another reason to define a brand-new model. Since reading the working day calendar information from the model will still follow the data access control as a standard model object. A brand-new model under public folder will avoid additional effort for authentication configuration.

For more details about how to set up a working day calendar in a model, please check the related help document:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/785164b1c1234c5286882ff085e4d23d.html#how-to-set-up-a-working-day-calendar-in-a-model

 

How to use the working day calendar for your series

Currently, the working day calendar can be used in the recurrence setting, which is used in some features, including:

Calendar task, Schedule Publication, Data Change Insight.

Using Calendar task as an example, when create a task which needs to be recursive, the option to use working day calendar will be available.

As shown in the above screenshot, user can set the recurrence patten and select the desired days for working days. User will be able to choose the corresponding model and property created in advance.

If the recurrence pattern is set to week or month, the working day calendar is also available with similar behavior.

Besides the recurrent setting in task design, the working day calendar can also be used in the calendar list view.

In the Gantt Chart Settings, user can also enable showing the calendar with working day calendar.

Once this setting is turned on, the gantt chart display will display the non-working days in grey if there's at least one event loaded in the calendar.

For more details about how to set up recurrence using working day calendar, please check the below online document:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/785164b1c1234c5286882ff085e4d23d.html#how-to-set-up-recurrence-using-a-working-day-calendar

The settings for Schedule Publication and Data Change Insight will be similar.

You may also check the below demo video as reference.

 

If the above video doesn't work, you may also check it via below link:

https://video.sap.com/media/t/1_byk63fen

 

Thanks a lot and let us know if you have any questions or comments.

best regards, Roy

entry.title: Three "hidden" features in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
SAP Analytics Cloud continues to evolve as a leading platform for analytics, planning and intelligent insights. Yet many users are unaware of the rich set of ‚Äûhidden‚Äú capabilities that sit beyond the standard functionality. These lesser known features offer meaningful advantages: from improving user experience to simplifying complex workflows. This blog highlights some of SAP Analytics Cloud‚Äôs most valuable but often overlooked tools that can significantly enhance how organizations interact with their data.

 

FEATURE 1 - BOOKMARKS

What are Bookmarks in SAP Analytics Cloud?

A Bookmark is a saved state of a story or page. It captures how the page looks at that moment, including ‚Äì filters you selected, input controls, variable selections, drill levels etc. it‚Äôs like taking a snapshot of your story/page settings and not the data itself.

Why are Bookmarks useful?

  • Quickly return to your preferred view ‚Äì if the story is complex, with many filters and drilldowns, you can setup a view once and refer back to it as needed.
  • Shre personalized views with others ‚Äì you can create a bookmark and share it with specific users. Each user still has the latest live data not a static snapshot of the data.
  • Reduce user errors ‚Äì instead of another user trying to recreate the view you have created, you can simply send them a bookmark and they view exactly what you see.

Steps to create a Bookmark:

In View mode: you can Bookmark the current state of a story to quickly return to it. Simply go to

The following screen will open:

You can enter a name and click on Save. Once saved you can check under Open Saved Bookmarks:

This will open the version you‚Äôve bookmarked in View mode, you can still go into Edit mode and edit the bookmarked screen.

 

FEATURE 2 ‚Äì SMART INSIGHTS

What are Smart Insights?

Smart Insights is an AI powered feature in SAP Analytics Cloud that can save time instead of manually creating reports to quickly view specific data. It helps non-technical users understand data ‚Äì people who aren't analysts can instantly get a view of the data that they need without having to build a report.

Why are Smart Insights useful?

  • Supports faster decision making ‚Äì Smart Insights turns raw data into actionable insights.
  • Easy access of information ‚Äì can quickly check sales for a specific location within your data.

Steps to use Smart Insights:

From Home you can access Smart Insights (Just Ask)

You can also access Smart Insights from

This can be accessed from anywhere in SAP Analytics Cloud as it is pinned to the Toolbar area of SAP Analytics Cloud.

After clicking on the Smart Insights icon you will be taken to this screen:

Click on the ‚ÄúIndexed Acquired Models‚Äù dropdown and select your model:

Once you have selected your model, you can start selecting fields from the model you want to see. In this example I will look at Quantity Sold and Location:

Hit enter or click the blue lightbulb and SAP Analytics Cloud will start creating the visualizations for you:

P.S: This can also be viewed as a table and Data Analyzer can be accessed as well.

 

FEATURE 3: COMMENTS AND COLLABORATION

What are Comments in SAP Analytics Cloud?

Comments let you add notes, explanations, discussions or action items directly inside a story or dashboard. It's basically in-story communication, so people don‚Äôt need to leave SAP Analytics Cloud to discuss the data.

Why are Comments useful?

  • Keeps conversations in one place ‚Äì with Comments, the discussion stays right next to the actual data, no context gets lost and no emails need to be sent.
  • Improves collaboration ‚Äì teams can: ask questions, tag people, provide explanations etc, all directly in the dashboard. It turns dashboards into collaborative tools.
  • Useful for audit trails ‚Äì Comments create a record of: decisions, discussions, explanations etc. if there is a question on the data months after a decision has been made; there us a clear trail to follow.

Steps to create Comments:

Click on the  in the Toolbar, go to Others and Click on Comment:

Below the Table you will see a Comment Widget loading and appear:

Click on ‚ÄúClick to add Comment‚Äù:

 To add in another comment after this click on the comment icon and another comment section will open:

As organizations aim to make more informed, timely decisions, understanding the full breadth of SAP Analytics Cloud‚Äôs capabilities becomes increasingly important. The ‚Äúhidden‚Äù features discussed in this blog demonstrate how much more the platform can offer beyond the basics. By integrating these functionalities into your everyday processes, you can create more efficient workflows, more interactive stories and ultimately more impactful analytics. Leveraging these tools ensures you are getting the most out of your SAP Analytics Cloud investment.

entry.title: SAP Certification Is Changing: What You Need to Know About the New Format
entry.content:
If you‚Äôve been following SAP‚Äôs certification updates, you‚Äôll know things are changing in a big way. The traditional multiple-choice exams are being replaced with a much more practical approach. I recently went through all the latest materials and sessions about the new SAP certification format, especially for SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), and I want to share what I learned and how you can prepare.

Why Is SAP Changing Its Certification Format?

SAP wants certifications to mean more than just passing a test. The new format is designed to make sure certified professionals can actually do the work required on real SAP projects. Instead of just memorizing theory, you‚Äôll be asked to solve problems and perform tasks that you‚Äôd encounter in your day-to-day job. This shift is great news for both candidates and employers. Companies can trust that certified consultants are ready for hands-on work, and candidates can show they‚Äôre truly job-ready.

What‚Äôs Different About the New Exams?

The biggest change is the move to performance-based assessments. You‚Äôll be asked to complete tasks in a simulated SAP system, or respond to real-world scenarios, sometimes interacting with an AI avatar or submitting a video response. You can use SAP Help Portal, SAP Learning, and even SAP Joule (the AI tool) during the exam, just like you would on a real project. This open-book style makes the exam feel much more like actual work.

You also get to choose how you want to be assessed for some parts: either through an AI role-play or by uploading a video. After you finish, you‚Äôll receive instant feedback, including analytics on your technical depth and communication skills.

Role-Based Certifications and Staying Certified

SAP certifications are now tailored to specific job roles, such as developer, administrator, or architect. This means the exam content is more relevant to what you‚Äôll actually do in your role. Certifications aren‚Äôt permanent anymore. You‚Äôll need to complete a ‚Äústay-certified‚Äù assessment each year to keep your credential active. This helps ensure everyone stays up to date with the latest SAP technology and best practices.

Timeline for the New Format

The rollout starts in November 2025 for selected exams, including SAP BTP Administrator, SAP Build Developer, Solution Architect ‚Äì SAP BTP, SAP Business Data Cloud, and SAP Generative AI Developer. By 2026, all SAP certifications will use this new practical format.

What Hasn‚Äôt Changed?

You‚Äôll still get a digital badge when you pass, and the registration process is the same as before. If you already have a certification, it remains valid, but you‚Äôll need to follow the renewal process to keep it active.

How Should You Prepare?

Focus on building practical SAP skills. Spend time working in SAP simulation environments, and practice explaining SAP solutions clearly and simply. Get comfortable with timed tasks and AI evaluation, and make sure your laptop, internet, webcam, and audio all meet SAP‚Äôs technical requirements before exam day.

Spotlight on SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) Certification

The BDC certification is a great example of the new approach. It covers foundational knowledge and practical skills in SAP Business Data Cloud. The assessment includes technical knowledge of BDC, integration with SAP Business Warehouse, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Databricks. To earn the badge, you‚Äôll need to complete the recommended SAP Learning Journey and pass the C_BCBDC exam. Remember to renew your badge every year.

Exam questions breakdown from my attempt:

 

  • Technical Knowledge of BDC (40%)
  • Integration with SAP Business Warehouse (15%)
  • Technical Knowledge of SAP Analytics Cloud (15%)
  • Technical Knowledge of SAP Datasphere (15%)
  • Technical Knowledge of SAP Databricks (15%)

 

Tips for Success

Take your time and use the pause button to think before you answer. Break your responses into clear chunks, and don‚Äôt worry about giving too much information, there‚Äôs no penalty for being thorough. Read the feedback you get and use it to improve before your next attempt. And don‚Äôt rush; you have plenty of time.

Useful Links

Here are some resources that helped me:

  • SAP Certification Overview
  • SAP Certification in the Age of AI
  • SAP BDC Learning Journey
  • SAP Certification BDC

Final Thoughts

SAP‚Äôs new certification format is a big step forward. It‚Äôs designed to make sure credentials really mean something and that certified professionals are ready for real project work. If you‚Äôre preparing for the SAP Business Data Cloud certification, focus on practical skills, clear communication, and continuous learning. The future of SAP certification is here, and it‚Äôs all about being ready for the real world.

If you have questions or want to share your experience with the new SAP certification, I‚Äôd love to hear from you in the comments.

entry.title: New Customer Influence Sessions for SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
Hi all,

Since the launch of SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC), in February 2025, we have been overwhelmed with the level of customer interest and adoption. As we began the rollout, we have had several feedback programs with customers to help bring them live for the key use cases we seek to enable. We now want to scale this to a broader community of customers through SAP Influence.

We are writing this post to announce 2 things:

  1. We are renaming our existing Data & Analytics sessions to BDC Datasphere and BDC: SAP Analytics Cloud. This move has no impact on investment priorities or the delivery of existing ideas. We are making this change to reflect that these products are now part of SAP Business Data Cloud.
  2. We are bringing onboard new influence communities for BDC Catalog, BDC BW Modernization, BDC: SAP Databricks, BDC Administration, BDC Connect, BDC Intelligent Applications & Data Products.

The changes to existing communities and creation of new communities will happen in the next couple of days. There will also be some movement of ideas between session categories over the next couple of weeks as we implement this new setup. We will update this blog with a link to the new sessions directly after we launch them. We will also add SAP BDC to the central entry point for key influence sessions located here. 

The reason we decided to split SAP BDC into multiple influence sessions is to make it easy for individual users to follow the areas which interest them. Some of these areas are early in their product lifecycle, but they will gain momentum over time and influence will help with this progress. 

We will also use this opportunity to improve our community's responsiveness and communication across all SAP BDC products by reusing the processes that we used for SAP Analytics Cloud in the last couple of years. We cannot deliver all customer requests, but Influence Communities are really useful to understand customer pain points and help identify customers who can deliver feedback on upcoming features. We are always listening and watching.

The BDC session group with its influence communities mentioned above will be owned by the BDC enablement, evangelism and community team under Subha Ramachandran, in Product Management. The influence sessions will be actively managed in partnership with our Product Success teams. I had the privilege to work on the initial strategy and set up the community because of my work on the SAP Analytics Cloud Influence session, which I will continue into the future.

Thanks,
Richard
